Title: Mid-level Data Scientist – Applied AI (B2C)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Trustpilot, we're on an incredible journey. We're a profitable, high-growth FTSE-250 company with a big vision: to become the universal symbol of trust. We run the world's largest independent consumer review platform, and while we've come a long way, there's still so much exciting work to do. Come join us at the heart of trust!

From millions of reviews to rich user interaction data, we have a vast amount of behavioral and content data that powers our consumer platform. In the B2C Applied AI team, we’re focused on leveraging AI and ML to improve how people discover, interact with, and trust businesses on Trustpilot.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our B2C Applied AI team to build intelligent, data-driven product features that improve user experience and deliver business impact. You will collaborate closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, designers, data analysts, and ML engineers to develop and maintain impactful AI/ML models at scale.

To succeed in this role, you’ll bring hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning solutions, especially in areas such as ranking, search, recommendations, and personalization. You’ll also demonstrate a strong understanding of user behavior data and how to use it to influence product development. A product mindset and ability to work cross-functionally are essential.

What You’ll Be Doing


Great opportunity to make a real product impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
Work on some of our most exciting Data Science initiatives aimed at improving the Trustpilot consumer experience: from ranking and recommendations to natural language processing and search.
Build, deploy, and maintain production-ready ML models that directly power features used by millions of users.
Collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and designers to develop user-facing features informed by ML and experimentation.
Use data and model insights to identify new opportunities for personalization and discovery across our platform.
Take ownership of specific ML features or components and drive them from concept to production and iteration.
Work with leading tools such as GCP Vertex AI, BigQuery, Airflow, and emerging ML technologies.
Be a part of a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace that encourages learning and growth.


Who You Are


Experience working in a Data Science or Machine Learning role, ideally on consumer-facing products like search, ranking, recommendations, personalization, or discovery.
Strong hands-on ability with ML modeling, including semantic search, ranking algorithms, clustering, recommendation systems, and natural language processing (NLP), with a track record of deploying models to production.
Strong skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and computational problem-solving; ideally with a background in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science.
Comfortable working with large-scale data and behavioral/user interaction data, and using it to build impactful, data-driven product features.
Proficient in Python and SQL, and confident working across the full ML lifecycle from exploration to deployment.
Experience with cloud platforms like GCP (preferred), AWS, or Azure, and tools such as BigQuery, Vertex AI, and Airflow.
Familiarity with ML production tooling and infrastructure, including CI/CD workflows.
Comfortable using metrics to monitor, iterate, and improve model performance.
Excellent communication skills — able to engage clearly and effectively with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
Collaborative and agile— experienced in working closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Engineers within cross-functional teams to create impactful solutions.
You take ownership, move quickly, and are driven to solve real user problems with scalable, measurable, and maintainable solutions.


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.
Show more
HTML:
At Trustpilot, we're on an incredible journey. We're a profitable, high-growth FTSE-250 company with a big vision: to become the universal symbol of trust. We run the world's largest independent consumer review platform, and while we've come a long way, there's still so much exciting work to do. Come join us at the heart of trust!

From millions of reviews to rich user interaction data, we have a vast amount of behavioral and content data that powers our consumer platform. In the B2C Applied AI team, we’re focused on leveraging AI and ML to improve how people discover, interact with, and trust businesses on Trustpilot.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our B2C Applied AI team to build intelligent, data-driven product features that improve user experience and deliver business impact. You will collaborate closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, designers, data analysts, and ML engineers to develop and maintain impactful AI/ML models at scale.

To succeed in this role, you’ll bring hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning solutions, especially in areas such as ranking, search, recommendations, and personalization. You’ll also demonstrate a strong understanding of user behavior data and how to use it to influence product development. A product mindset and ability to work cross-functionally are essential.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Great opportunity to make a real product impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
  • Work on some of our most exciting Data Science initiatives aimed at improving the Trustpilot consumer experience: from ranking and recommendations to natural language processing and search.
  • Build, deploy, and maintain production-ready ML models that directly power features used by millions of users.
  • Collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and designers to develop user-facing features informed by ML and experimentation.
  • Use data and model insights to identify new opportunities for personalization and discovery across our platform.
  • Take ownership of specific ML features or components and drive them from concept to production and iteration.
  • Work with leading tools such as GCP Vertex AI, BigQuery, Airflow, and emerging ML technologies.
  • Be a part of a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace that encourages learning and growth.

Who You Are

  • Experience working in a Data Science or Machine Learning role, ideally on consumer-facing products like search, ranking, recommendations, personalization, or discovery.
  • Strong hands-on ability with ML modeling, including semantic search, ranking algorithms, clustering, recommendation systems, and natural language processing (NLP), with a track record of deploying models to production.
  • Strong skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and computational problem-solving; ideally with a background in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science.
  • Comfortable working with large-scale data and behavioral/user interaction data, and using it to build impactful, data-driven product features.
  • Proficient in Python and SQL, and confident working across the full ML lifecycle from exploration to deployment.
  • Experience with cloud platforms like GCP (preferred), AWS, or Azure, and tools such as BigQuery, Vertex AI, and Airflow.
  • Familiarity with ML production tooling and infrastructure, including CI/CD workflows.
  • Comfortable using metrics to monitor, iterate, and improve model performance.
  • Excellent communication skills — able to engage clearly and effectively with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
  • Collaborative and agile— experienced in working closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Engineers within cross-functional teams to create impactful solutions.
  • You take ownership, move quickly, and are driven to solve real user problems with scalable, measurable, and maintainable solutions.

What's in it for you?

  • A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
  • Competitive compensation package + bonus
  • 25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
  • Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
  • Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
  • Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
  • Paid parental leave
  • Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
  • Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
  • Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
  • Employee discounts to restaurants and shops

Title: Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities

Design, develop, train, and evaluate deep learning models (CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, etc.)
Collaborate with data scientists to understand business requirements and translate them into robust ML solutions
Optimize models for inference (e.g., quantization, pruning, ONNX, TensorRT)
Deploy models to production environments (e.g., via REST APIs, edge devices, or cloud platforms)
Conduct data preprocessing, augmentation, and exploratory data analysis
Maintain and improve MLOps pipelines for training, testing, and monitoring
Document experiments, results, and best practices for future reference

Requirements

Proven experience (3+ years) in deep learning and model deployment
Strong proficiency in Python and DL frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Familiarity with model versioning, reproducibility, and experiment tracking (MLflow, Weights & Biases)
Strong understanding of data structures, computer vision or NLP (depending on the project)
Solid background in mathematics/statistics (linear algebra, probability, optimization)
Ability to work independently and communicate clearly in a cross-functional team

Show more

  • Deploy models to production environments (e.g., via REST APIs, edge devices, or cloud platforms)
  • Conduct data preprocessing, augmentation, and exploratory data analysis
  • Maintain and improve MLOps pipelines for training, testing, and monitoring
  • Document experiments, results, and best practices for future reference

  • Strong understanding of data structures, computer vision or NLP (depending on the project)
  • Solid background in mathematics/statistics (linear algebra, probability, optimization)
  • Ability to work independently and communicate clearly in a cross-functional team

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

Job Type: Permanent

Industry: Financial Services / Capital Markets

Work Mode: Hybrid (On-site 4 days/week)




About the Client:

We have partnered with a Danish company specialising in Algorithmic Trading. The company has been the market leader in automating financial markets since 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




About the role:

As part of this role, you’ll help design, optimize, and implement calibration and benchmarking frameworks, establish best practices for data processing pipelines, and prototype innovative predictive time-series models. With short feedback cycles, direct deployment, and minimal bureaucracy, your work will have immediate impact.




Team Environment:

You'll join a collaborative, intellectually curious team that values technical input and personal initiative. The group is composed of highly qualified researchers with deep experience in statistics, modelling, and machine learning, working closely with software engineering and trading teams. Knowledge-sharing is integral, and all members contribute code, ensuring mutual understanding across specialties.




Candidate Profile:

PhD or MSc in a quantitative discipline (engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics, or related fields)
Strong foundation in mathematics and statistics
Experience with the full machine learning development cycle—from data processing to deployment and monitoring
Proficiency in Python, especially for data processing and numerical analysis
Solid grasp of computer science principles
Analytical, scientific mindset
Right to work in Denmark(We can't offer sponsorship)




Bonus skills:

Experience handling large, complex datasets
Familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, XGBoost, or CatBoost
Additional programming experience in languages like C# or C/C++




What’s offered:

Flat organizational structure fostering trust and autonomy
Challenging, interesting problems to solve
Supportive and highly skilled team
Modern workspace with a hybrid work model
Comprehensive benefits including pension, health insurance, and generous leave
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data scientist with a passion for language, logic, and large language models

To support our continued growth and innovation, we are seeking a Data scientist to join our team in Aarhus. This is a unique opportunity to combine your love of language, structure, and data models, to help shape how we use LLMs, and other machine learning technologies in customer-facing solutions.

Who We Are

Founded in a garage in 2016 and now headquartered in the heart of Aarhus, Adversus is a fast-growing SaaS company with a talented team of +50 colleagues. We’ve established ourselves as a leading provider of cloud-based call center software, serving customers in more than 35 countries across the globe. We build smart, scalable solutions—and we always seek new ways to work smarter, not harder.

What You Will Be Doing

As our Data Scientist, you will help design, test, evaluate and refine the technologies that drive accurate, useful, and creative outputs from machine learning models. You’ll collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and customer-facing teams to ensure our AI features are reliable, effective, and aligned with real-world needs.

You will play a critical role in unlocking the full potential of AI across our platform, helping our customers with automated workflows, content creation, quality assurance, and improving their interactions with our platform.

How We See You


A structured thinker with a flair for language and logic
Familiar with tools like OpenAI’s GPT-4, and prompt engineering best practices
Able to package AI interactions in a format suitable for API consumption.
A pragmatic engineer with a solid understanding of technology limits, but also keeping an eye on the opportunities
Comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced environment
You’re fluent in English, both written and verbal.


Key Responsibilities


Craft, and iterate on effective inputs to power AI-driven features
Collaborate with development teams to integrate AI outputs into product workflows
Evaluate model behavior, identify edge cases, and propose improvements
Maintain libraries and documentation for internal use
Explore fine-tuning, embeddings, and retrieval techniques to improve performance
Stay up-to-date with AI advancements and bring fresh ideas to the team


If you’re a language lover, systems thinker, and AI enthusiast ready to turn creativity into capability, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive meaningful change

At our Data & Analytics department, we specialize in data visualizations, BI tools, analytical consulting, statistics, forecasting, and modern data platforms. Working closely with various departments across Abacus, we combine our analytical expertise with a deep understanding of pharmaceutical markets—from product development to delivery.

We believe that robust Data Science and AI can give Abacus Medicine a competitive edge, uncovering trends and behaviors that drive smarter decision-making. Our advanced machine learning techniques transform complex market data into actionable forecasts. Join us on our growth journey and help shape the future of the pharmaceutical industry.

Get a glimpse of our world

The Data Science team consists of five highly skilled professionals, all dedicated to improve global healthcare through better access to medicine by delivering critical data and insights that drive informed decision-making.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including data analysts, data engineers, product managers, and key business stakeholders—to develop data-driven solutions that scale.

Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

As a Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that power business insights and operational efficiencies and support tactical and strategic decision-making across Abacus Medicine.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Design, develop, and deploy advanced models, including machine learning, deep learning, and algorithmic solutions, to solve complex business problems.
Analyze datasets to generate actionable insights, ensuring data-driven decision-making.
Design and maintain scalable MLOps pipelines for seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.
Promote best practices in Data Science by optimizing workflows and expanding the DS/ML toolbox with tools that enhance model accuracy, runtime, and maintainability.
Strengthen our technical infrastructure by integrating modern technologies that enhance efficiency, scalability, and long-term maintainability.
Drive innovation by evaluating and integrating emerging ML/AI methodologies, including LLMs, to enhance model performance.
Translate complex model results into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Share expertise through knowledge sharing and sparring sessions.
Proactively identify potential data science applications for value creation.
Contribute to branch development initiatives and long-term planning, including roadmap definition.


Fuel for your success in the role

We Imagine You Have


Master’s degree in a data science-related field (e.g., computer science, cognitive science, IT, mathematics/statistics, economics).
Advanced Python programming skills.
Proficient in Data Science skills – ML frameworks (scikit-learn, deep learning frameworks), data wrangling, data analysis, and visualization.
Experienced with the following technologies: SQL, Web APIs, Git, Linux commands.
Excellent English communication skills with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Show genuine care for both team dynamics and the success of the organization, fostering a positive and inclusive work culture.


Preferred Qualifications


Prior working experience in applying data science, with a focus on machine learning and predictive modeling.
Familiarity with the following technologies: MLOps, Spark, Cloud platform (e.g. Azure/AWS), mlflow, ETL processes, CI/CD processes.
Databricks environment for building and deploying ML models.
Leveraging LLMs for enhancing the performance of ML models through prompt engineering and embeddings.


Interested?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV.

To help us better understand your motivation and qualifications for this role, we kindly encourage you to attach both your cover letter and academic transcript. This will give us a clearer overview of your interests and the courses you have completed during your studies.

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager,

Mihai Popovici, Advanced Analytics, Data Science & Tech Lead at mihai.popovici@abacusmedicine.com

Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Please note that the position will remain open until we find the right candidate, after which the job advertisement will be removed. We encourage interested applicants to submit their applications as early as possible.

Please note that due to the upcoming summer holiday period, the recruitment process may take slightly longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and understanding.

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Engineers (x2) – Product-Led Startup

60,000–80,000 DKK/month

Copenhagen (Hybrid – 3 to 4 days/week in office)




We’re helping a well-backed AI startup scale their core engineering team with two new hires – hands-on AI engineers who can contribute across the stack and help bring multiple live products to the next level.




This is a small, senior team where you’ll be working directly with founders, shipping production features fast, and playing a meaningful role in shaping the product and tech direction.




What we’re looking for:

Engineers with a strong product mindset and experience in fast-moving environments
Solid exposure to LLMs, RAG workflows, vector databases, or frameworks like Langchain
Comfortable working in .NET and React, but tech isn't everything – mindset is key
Cloud-first thinking – you’ve built and shipped systems, not just hooked into them
No freelancers or short-termers – we’re looking for people who’ve grown with a company




Tech environment:

RAG, Langchain, vector DBs
.NET
React




Even if you do not feel like you tick all of the boxes, please still apply - we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Junior Data Scientist (student) at Choreograph
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Choreograph søger en Junior Data Scientist med passion for at omsætte data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Trives du med at finde mønstre i data og omsætte dem til meningsfulde indsigter i Python – eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter. Vi søger en bachelor- eller kandidatstuderende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Choreograph er en del af WPP Media, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Choreograph er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geografiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et fagligt stærkt og anerkendt team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Choreograph

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Backend Engineer - Python - Copenhagen




We’re delighted to be working with one of Europe’s most exciting tech startups, as they continue their mission to become the leader in their market.




They’re looking to onboard an experienced backend engineer, to join one of their internal teams.




The Role




In this role, you'll be working as part of the Business Ops team - which focuses on internal processes, developer tools & creating the best possible work environment for both technical & non-technical team members.




You'll work closely with a team of engineers as well as non-technical stakeholders, before crafting innovative solutions to every day problems.




You'll be using Python, with Django being used as their main framework. Whilst this specific role is purely backend focused, they do have space for a Full Stack Engineer in the near future - so don't hesitate to reach out if you have solid TypeScript experience too.




What You’ll Bring




5+ years of commercial software engineering experience
3+ years of experience working with Python
Demonstratable experience of working with internal teams with non-technical staff
Any experience in TypeScript is a plus, but certainly not required




The Company




With a current team of over 400 and huge growth planned in the next few years, this is an opportunity to get in while the rocket ship’s still near the launchpad.




Their tech is used by tens of thousands of teams across the globe every week—helping analysts record, analyse, and improve performance with ease.




The company’s mission is a positive and inclusive one: to ensure access to performance tools, regardless of background, budget, or location.




Their Copenhagen HQ is the coolest office I’ve ever visited, so I’m sure you’ll agree. Most of their team are onsite between 3-5 days a week. They offer flexibility on remote working, but their staff like being in the office more often than not.




Sound good? Apply here or contact me directly on jamie.crowley@amicusjobs.com.

Title: Data Scientist med AI/ML-fokus til EWIIs Digitale Kundeplatforme
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hvem er vi?

Vi er en energikoncern der leverer vand og fjernvarme i trekantområdet samt el, bredbånd og ladeløsninger til kunder i hele Danmark. Vi har inden for de seneste år udskiftet alle vores digitale kundevendte platforme, og har nu en stærk digital tilstedeværelse med vores hjemmeside, flere selvbetjeningsløsninger, mobilapps og en marketing automation platform. Platformene er integrerede med hinanden og bygget på en moderne og prisbelønnet integrationsplatform, hvor data er gjort tilgængelige via microservices.

I Digitale Kundeplatforme drifter og videreudvikler vi platformene i tæt samarbejde med andre forretningsområder og vores eget tilknyttede IT-udviklingsteam. Vi er allerede i gang med at implementere databaserede løsninger, som en del af vores digitale kundeoplevelser, og ønsker nu at tage næste skridt og sætte fart på udviklingen.

Om rollen

Du bliver teamets specialist i machine learning og AI og får ansvar for at udvikle, teste og implementere modeller, der udgør det datamæssige fundament for nye digitale løsninger og services til vores kunder.

Du kommer til at arbejde hands-on med modellering, databehandling og kode – i tæt samspil med relevante afdelinger såsom IT-infrastruktur, Data Warehouse og Data Governance. Derudover vil du arbejde sammen med dine kollegaer i teamet, der arbejder med app, web, selvbetjening og marketing automation, om at integrere modellerne direkte i vores digitale platforme og løsninger, så de skaber reel værdi for vores kunder.

Hos EWII arbejder andre data scientists med forskellige formål på tværs af organisationen, og vi har allerede et stærkt teknologi- og datasetup på plads. I denne rolle får du ansvar for at udvikle modeller baseret på kundernes forbrugs- og adfærdsdata – kombineret med relevante tredjepartsdata såsom vejr- og boligdata.

Eksempler på arbejdsopgaver



Udvikling og optimering af prædiktive og præskriptive modeller, som danner udgangspunkt for vores automatiserede kommunikation
Udvikling og optimering af forbrugsalarmer baseret på machine learning og anomalidetektion, som automatisk kan opdage, hvis den enkelte kundes forbrug afviger fra deres normalforbrug
Udvikling af personaliserede forbrugsrapporter baseret på dataanalyse og integreret med generativt AI, som genererer individuelle rapporter med grafer og forklarende tekst.
Udforske nye teknologier og eksperimentere med ML- og AI-baserede løsninger på tværs af platformene.



Det tilbyder vi 

Som medarbejder i EWII er det ikke kun dit arbejde, der er i centrum - du får også mange personalegoder, der er værd at arbejde for. Hvilke goder, du kan nyde godt af, kan du blive klogere på her. 

Din profil

Vi forestiller os, at du har en uddannelse inden for datalogi, machine learning, statistik eller lignende – fx cand.scient., cand.polyt. eller cand.it med specialisering i data science. Du har allerede nogen erfaring, og har et ønske om at arbejde tættere sammen med forretningen om dine modeller.

Vi lægger vægt på, at du:



Har praktisk erfaring med dataanalyse, statistisk modellering og machine learning i cloud-baserede miljøer, herunder udvikling af prædiktive og preskriptive modeller på Azure Databricks-platformen.
Har stærke kompetencer inden for Python og SQL.
Forstår, hvordan modeller omsættes til værdi i en digital forretningskontekst og gerne i forbindelse med digitale kundevendte platforme.
Trives i krydsfeltet mellem teknik og forretning og kan forklare komplekse modeller og resultater til ikke-tekniske kollegaer
Er nysgerrig, forretningsorienteret og trives med et stort selvstændigt ansvar for dit ansvarsområde, men sætter pris på at arbejde teamorienteret mod vores fælles vision og mål.



I rollen får du



En central rolle i et ambitiøst digitalt team med stærkt mandat og stor indflydelse.
Frihed til at eksperimentere og udvikle dine egne idéer til ML- og AI-baserede kundeløsninger
Samarbejde med kollegaer, der arbejder med digital performance, UX, app- og webudvikling, marketing automation og dataplatforme
Adgang til en moderne teknologistak samtidig med, at du bliver en del af en virksomhed med strategisk fokus på digital innovation.



Sæt et grønt fodspor sammen med os 

I EWII er hverdagen vidt forskellig for vores 700 medarbejdere. Men fælles for alle er, at fagligheden når helt ud i fingerspidserne – og den skal male fremtiden grøn. 

I EWIIs kommercielle afdelinger kridter vi kondiskoene hver dag – uanset om vi lægger arm med energimarkedet, digitaliserer forretningen eller flytter danskerne over på fiber. Sammen gør vi det, der er sort til grøn business – til gavn for miljø, kunder og bundlinje. 

Er du vores nye kollega?

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig. Du sender sit CV og motiverede ansøgning ved at klikke på ansøgningsknappen. Hos os er diversitet og forskellighed en styrke, og derfor er alle ansøgninger velkomne uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, civilstand etc.  

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet eller EWII som arbejdsplads, så kontakt endelig afdelingsleder, Jakob Linde, på tlf. 28 25 26 85. Du kan læse mere om os som virksomhed og arbejdsplads på ewii.dk. Er du mere nysgerrig, kan du også følge med ovre på LinkedIn, Facebook og Instagram. 

Stillingen besættes hurtigst muligt, og du kan søge den, så længe den er online på ewii.dk. Vi forventer at afholde de første samtaler i uge 32 og 33.

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Grün, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).
Show more

At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

requisitionid:20868

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models to meet project-specific guidelines.
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
Ensuring clarity, consistency, and factual accuracy.
Providing feedback to writers and working with QA Specialists to uphold quality


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Experience with Cloud sourcing platform is a plus
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Research Scientist – Bioanalytical Team

Location: Hørsholm, Denmark

We are seeking an experienced Research Scientist to join the Bioanalytical Team at FMC’s European Innovation Centre in Hørsholm.

You will be a key member in our natural product development projects working closely together with microbiology, fermentation, formulation and field experts. You will perform chemical analysis on conventional products as well as produce, isolate, purify and characterise new and known natural products for testing as agrochemicals using advanced instruments such as HPLC, LC-QTOF, LC-MS/MS and prep flash chromatography system.

Key Responsibilities


Preparation of selected natural products. This includes arranging source material, crude material extraction and isolating, purifying and characterising the desired compounds.
Chemical analysis of known targets in samples deriving from R&D teams
Manage collaborations with internal/external partners for additional sample preparation and chemical characterisation
Support members of the team with instrument troubleshooting and development of analytical methods
Routine maintenance and qualification of laboratory instruments
General housekeeping, and contributing to safety activities


About You

You are a proactive and collaborative scientist who thrives in a dynamic environment and in a job that requires hands on lab work. You have strong communication skills and the ability to build good relationships with people around you.

You Bring


PhD and 3+ years of experience working with natural product chemistry
Experience in analysis of complex mixtures and isolation and purification of milligram amounts using LC-QTOF, Prep HPLC and flash chromatography
Familiar with techniques used for structure elucidation
Knowledge of natural product literature and technologies
Excellent communication and collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment
Confidence working in English, our primary business language


Why FMC?

At FMC, you'll join a supportive, purpose-driven team committed to innovation in sustainable agriculture. We invest in our people and encourage continuous learning and career development.

FMC Corporation is a global agricultural sciences company developing advanced solutions that combine synthetic and biological crop protection, plant health, and precision agriculture technologies.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and will close the vacancy once the right candidate is found.

Interested? We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)
Company: Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen
Description:
Job portal
All vacancies


Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:


MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
Excellent data handling and analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
Experience with AI/machine learning


Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:


Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
Experience with GDPR compliance
Experience with database design and management
Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)


Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH – Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:


Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience


Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Search all vacancies

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
🚀 We're Hiring: MLOps Engineer | Copenhagen | Hybrid Work

Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)




Are you passionate about building reliable, scalable platforms for machine learning? We’re looking for an experienced IT Platform Engineer to help shape and support a cutting-edge MLOps environment that powers real-time model deployment and scoring across critical domains, including fraud detection and online payments.




🌍 The Role

Join a collaborative squad focused on delivering a future-proof MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You'll take ownership of automating model life cycles—from development to deployment—and build CI/CD workflows, infrastructure as code, and robust ML pipelines that scale with enterprise needs.




🔧 Tech You’ll Use

Cloud: AWS (extensive use), Databricks
Languages: Python, PySpark
Infra: Terraform, Docker, GitHub Actions
Tools: MLflow for model tracking/versioning, container orchestration
Bonus: Experience with Kafka or Pub/Sub streaming is a big plus!




🎯 What You’ll Be Doing

Develop and maintain automated pipelines for ML model training, validation, and inference
Build CI/CD workflows that seamlessly move models into production
Containerize ML workloads and manage infrastructure using best-in-class tools
Collaborate in an agile setup




👤 About You

You bring at least 2 years of hands-on experience in MLOps, solid cloud knowledge, strong Python and infrastructure-as-code skills, and an eye for performance and reliability. You’re a proactive problem-solver, a team player, and passionate about scaling ML in production.




💼 What’s In It for You

A human-centred, inclusive work culture
Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)
Flexible hybrid working setup
Access to development programs and professional certifications
Comprehensive health, insurance, and well-being benefits
A competitive compensation package and extra leave options




📍Location: Copenhagen

📅 Apply now and help us transform how machine learning supports real-world impact.

#MLOps #Python #AWS #Databricks #Terraform #CI/CD #MachineLearning #TechJobs #CopenhagenJobs #HiringNow #CloudEngineering

Title: AI/ML Intern (Full-time, Fall 2025)
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about shaping the future of artificial intelligence? Do you want to work on real-world product innovations? Join our AI team at Bang & Olufsen, where we translate state-of-the-art machine learning into products that define the future of sound and interaction.

What You Bring

A real passion and interest for Artificial Intelligence. In order to set you up for success as an intern, we also look for the following skills and experience:



Currently enrolled in a Master's degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Keras.
Demonstrated interest or experience in developing and optimizing algorithms for real-world problems.
Solid understanding of the data lifecycle—from collection to cleaning and model validation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.



What We Offer

Working with the latest machine learning, artificial intelligence, and signal and information processing technology, you will be involved in the design and development pipeline of innovative artificial intelligence solutions.

You will become part of the Artificial Intelligence Group at Bang & Olufsen in Lyngby, dedicated to pioneering advanced AI research for developing systems ready for market integration that facilitate Bang & Olufsen's hallmark user experiences. We cover almost all fields of machine learning. You will be integrated into a multidisciplinary team composed of both machine learning researchers and engineers. Given AI's broad impact, our efforts intersect various technical domains with a special focus on audio and acoustics, fundamental to our brand. The position also offers the chance to engage with and work alongside a diverse group of specialists within various departments at Bang & Olufsen.

From the very first day of your internship, your mentor will closely guide you throughout your time with us. You will work alongside our engineers as an equal member of our team and therefore have a great impact on different parts of our creative processes.

With approximately 1100 employees, Bang & Olufsen is an agile company that gives room for individual flexibility and decision-making. Our hierarchy is flat, and our communication is open and trustworthy. We believe in mutual respect and with a unique pool of people coming from +55 countries we aim to build a more inclusive workplace to grow as professionals and as a company and remain innovative.

Compensation: Attractive salary and benefits package

Location: Kongens Lyngby, Denmark or Struer, Denmark

Start date: Ideally September 1st, 2025 but we're flexible for a prompt start thereafter

Duration: Approximately 6–8 months,full-time

Travel: Approx. 5%

How To Apply

Submit your CV (in English) and grade transcripts by pressing the ‘Apply’ button. Applications are assessed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than August 10th 2025. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible; this advert could be close before the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications.

At Bang & Olufsen, we believe in equal opportunities for all. We encourage applicants to focus on their qualifications, skills, and experience when submitting their CVs. Please refrain from including personal information such as photographs. Our hiring decisions are based solely on merit, and we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal chance to succeed. If you see yourself in the position and believe you have the potential to support build B&O's future, even if you don't meet all the requirements, we sincerely encourage you to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

Read more about our recruitment process and explore your career opportunities within Bang & Olufsen here.

Bang & Olufsen has, for 100 years, developed luxury audio products that change moods and inspire minds. With offices in Denmark (headquartered in Struer) and the rest of the world, Bang & Olufsen is determined to create products that push the boundaries of audio technology. To this day, every product is still characterized by the unique combination of beautiful sound, timeless design and unrivalled craftmanship.

Title: Lead AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Company Overview

team.blue is the market leader in enabling digital success for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) across Europe, catering to over 3 million customers in 25+ languages. Our mission is to make online business success simpler, by providing our customers with all the tools and resources they need to excel online and remain ahead of the curve.

Position Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Lead AI/ML Engineer to technically lead our AI/ML engineering team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing AI & ML models and GenAI solutions that power real production use cases. This role will collaborate closely with Product, and Commercial teams, and take full ownership from ideation to deployment. The environment is fast-paced and high-responsibility, with plenty of room to grow alongside a technical, mission-driven team.

Key Responsibilities:

AI & ML Model Development & Implementation


Design, develop and optimize AI models and LLMs, including training and fine-tuning for various applications
Build, train and optimize ML models, including defining preprocessing, feature engineering, validation strategies, and hyperparameter tuning
Develop AI solutions using LLMs, agentic AI frameworks, RAG pipelines, MCP servers and other related technologies



AI & ML Engineering


Build data ingestion and transformation pipelines to support model training and deployment and ensure reproducible, scalable models
Verify data quality, perform data cleaning, and oversee data acquisition processes as needed.
Develop scalable training and inference pipelines for AI-powered applications



Deployment & Integration


Deploy models to production and create APIs to integrate AI models into business operations
Build and drive adoption of emerging LLM/MLOPs technologies, integrating AI Agents, RAGs, and LLMs using MCP workflows to streamline automation, performance tuning, and large-scale data insights



Research & Innovation


Continously research and integrate the latest advancements in AI, ML and LLMs into products
Translate scientific insights into working prototypes that bridge research and production-ready implementation
Collaborate with internal and external research partners, including academic institutions, industry labs, and vendors



Technical Leadership


Provide technical leadership in AI/ML technologies, including GenAI, Machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing (NLP).
Ensure the technical quality of AI/ML solutions, including architecture, design, implementation, and deployment.
Mentor junior team members and drive the technical direction of AI initiatives within the group



Requirements:


6+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering, Applied AI or Research engineering, with 2+ years in a lead role
Deep expertise with GenAI technologies and concepts like LLMs, RAG, Vector databases, AI agents, MCP, LoRA, QLoRA
Strong Python skills and experience with ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, sklearn), with a proven track record of building and deploying ML models
Practical experience deploying and scaling AI & ML models and agentic AI applications in a production environment, including with LLM inference and serving (vLLm, LiteLLM, TensorRT-LLM)
Knowledge of LLM/MLOps, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Awareness of LLM-specific risk domains, including hallucinations, fairness, and data privacy
Strong problem-solving skills with excellent communication and documentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams



Nice to have Skills:


Experience building multi-hop RAG systems with self-consistency and chain-of-thought prompting



"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

ESG

“At team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.”

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 3,000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue

Title: Co-founders search – Machine Learning (ML, AI) / Building Expert (Building Engineer/Architect)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Based in Denmark | Remote | Part-time (Equity only for now)




We are HØUSE NEXT, a startup on a mission to make housing radically more affordable across Europe.

We are looking for people who describe themselves as bright, energetic, determined, and motivated by solving hard problems that can lead to a huge positive impact on the future. You are not just looking for a job — you are looking for a chance to build something that matters.




What We Are Building

We are currently focused on developing PERMIT NEXT, a digital service that automatically generates building permits based on customer-provided data.




We are starting with single-family dwellings and annexes.




The goal is to automate and simplify a process that is traditionally slow and complex.




Open Co-founder Roles

1. Co-founder A – Machine Learning Developer

You will lead development of the machine learning model for PERMIT NEXT.

Experience with:

Machine Learning (AI) with use of PDF based input data
JavaScript




2. Co-founder B – Building Expert

You will help shape the permitting service, especially focus on requirements of service as well as evaluation of generated permits, also work on hardware prototype (Model A).

Experience with:

Architecture / Civil or Structural Engineering
Building Codes and Regulatory Compliance




What You Should Know

Strong preference for candidates who speak a Scandinavian language
The role is currently unpaid (equity only)
Expected commitment: ~20 hours per week (flexible, remote)... The goal is to transition into a full-time paid position once funding is secured




If you are ready to take on an ambitious challenge and build something from the ground up, we would love to hear from you. It will be tough but the reward can be high.




Please reach out via direct message or email us at ak@høusenext.com ..

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist in GenAI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

At Danske Bank, combatting financial crime is more than a mission; it is our steadfast commitment to protecting our customers and communities from criminal activities. We aim to build a financial ecosystem of integrity and confidence, enabling communities to thrive and grow.

Are you ready to transform the financial crime prevention landscape? Join us at the forefront of technological innovation, utilizing generative AI to transform financial crime prevention processes within Danske Bank.

The Role

In this role, you will explore and evaluate pre-trained large language models (LLMs) to identify the best use cases and ensure their effective application. You will also develop innovative prompting techniques and strategies to reduce hallucinations and improve the quality of generated outputs.

Additionally, you will:


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement current solutions that reshape the financial crime risk management landscape.
Stay informed about the latest advancements in generative AI, bringing valuable insights and ideas to the team.


Your Profile

To thrive in this role, you should have a strong technical foundation and a keen interest in innovation in AI. You bring expertise in Python and commonly used AI/ML libraries and frameworks, such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Hugging Face. Your knowledge of machine learning and deep learning techniques is complemented by a focus on natural language processing (NLP).

Other key qualifications include:


Practical experience with prompting techniques (e.g., few-shot prompting, chain-of-thought prompting) and fine-tuning LLMs.
Extensive experience in designing and building scalable data pipelines for generative AI solutions (e.g., SQL, APIs, vector databases, relational databases).
Familiarity or direct experience with cloud data infrastructure, such as AWS, and optimising storage and query performance.
Prior expertise in generative AI, with practical experience implementing advanced solutions in this field.


Have we caught your attention?

If you believe this opportunity aligns with your aspirations, we would like to hear from you. For any questions, please contact Julius Vazgela, Chapter Lead, at https://www.linkedin.com/in/vazgela/

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.
