Title: Associate AI Engineer
Place: Humlebæk, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Studied Software Development or Data Science – do you want to become an Associate AI Engineer?

Would you like to join us as we scale our AI team? You have finished your studies want to start your career by bringing the right AI tools to the business to create value.

Join us as we identify the AI models and solutions, we configure to create a more effective business and ultimately make a difference to both people with intimate healthcare needs and healthcare professionals worldwide.

”Bringing your curiosity about AI and innovation to the table, you’ll get to work with the latest technology and make it come to life in an international company with a higher purpose,” says AI Lead, Simon Buemann.

A team dedicated to AI

Within Digital, Data and IT, you will be part of a relatively new AI team. The team is responsible for gathering and evaluating requirements for AI solutions from the entire business, creating roadmaps as well as identifying, configuring and developing the solutions into our setup.

“This area has a lot of interest from stakeholders across the business. We are working with brand new technology and contributing to innovation globally – and growing our team along the way,” explains Simon.

Deliver ethical and amazing AI solutions

With your team, your aim will be to deliver AI solutions that are aligned with Coloplast’s strategic goals and provide measurable business value. Throughout your work, it will be a priority to gather new knowledge on AI and contribute to the continuous improvement of our methodologies and practices.

Specifically, you will be delivering on our prioritised AI use cases in our roadmap to enhance operational efficiency and innovation. This covers all phases from refining business needs, developing solutions, setting up agents, configuring and grounding pre-built AI models, to testing and validation and finally creating documentation and supporting business roll-out. This also entails


Collaborating with team members, vendors, and business stakeholders from inception to deployment, ensuring quality, timeliness, and alignment with the business requirements and expectations
Working with team members, other developers, and vendors to design, develop, test, and deploy AI solutions within Azure and other platforms that meet the technical and functional specifications
Ensuring that we implement sufficient test and documentation procedures
Collaborating with IT and software development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI capabilities
Monitoring and evaluating the performance and impact of the AI solutions, and providing recommendations for improvement and optimisation




Knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications

In this role, you need good people skills to explain complex AI concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences. Also, you have a strong sense of structure and quality, allowing you to test our AI models and make sure we create the best solutions.

Finally, you enjoy learning, as AI is a constantly changing area, and we furthermore imagine that you


Hold a bachelor's degree or higher in Software Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
Have experience in software development and an understanding of AI model integration from your studies or work
Have worked in Azure and other cloud services, maybe with a track record of setting up AI models in these environments as part of your studies or work
Have programming experience writing clean maintainable code for instance in Python, .Net or other relevant coding languages from your studies or work
Have knowledge of access management and infrastructure as code
Have knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications, such as natural language processing, GenAI, machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, etc.
Are fluent in English
Some travel might be required in connection with project workshops etc.




Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please email AI Lead, Simon Buemann on dksibu@coloplast.com. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply as we a looking to fill the positions by October 1st.

The positions will remain open until suitable candidates has been found.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com.

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn. Like us on Facebook.

59299

Title: Service Engineer
Description:
Our belief:


At SOLPLANET, we are driven by a simple idea: solar for everybody
We strive to create the best possible experience for distributors, installers and end users
That´s why our solar inverters, energy storage systems and EV chargers are easy-to-install, reliable and user friendly


Who We Are:


Private equity-backed AISWEI is a leading provider of renewable energy solutions - providing the world with solar inverters, batteries, EV chargers, heat pumps, and energy management solutions
AISWEI has more than 15 years of expertise in R&D and manufacturing, with a strong technology heritage from both Germany and China
With 32 GW of annual production volumes (2024), AISWEI is one of the largest manufacturers of solar string inverters world-wide
AISWEI is operating under its own brand in China and its SOLPLANET brand internationally, and is trusted by leading global brands as an ODM service provider
Our team passionately believe that that we are all fellow citizens of one planet, and we are truly honored about deploying our solutions to local societies worldwide - every day


How you´ll help us:

As a Service Engineer:


Provide technical troubleshooting support to installers and other customers via phone or digital channels
Provide commissioning support (remote or on-site)
Actively collaborate with international and local colleagues/departments to effectively resolve customer issues
Plan and coordinate the logistics to dispatch inverters for replacement and assist in the collection of inverters
Support the qualification, onboarding and management of new service partners
Accurately document all relevant case information using CRM software
Deliver training sessions to customers or internal colleagues
Continuously identify opportunities to improve products and processes in order to improve customer satisfaction and company cost-effectiveness
Regularly collect feedback such as customer satisfaction to assist in continuous improvement of the after sales process


Requirements

Your background and skills:


Bachelor or above technical degrees, preferably in electrical engineering, renewable energy, photovoltaic engineering, or similar disciplines
Native in Danish and business fluent in English
In-depth knowledge of the technical requirements for PV, energy storage systems, EV chargers in the distribution and/or utility scale segments, including product specifications, grid code requirements, competitive landscape, tender requirements etc
Ability to work independently and focused in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Prior work experience in a PV related industry is not a necessity but will be an advantage


Your attributes:


Self-motivated and performance driven
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Can-do attitude and hands-on mindset
Proactive, dynamic, solution and customer oriented


Benefits

What we offer:


Giving you the unique opportunity to be part of a spirited and diverse team of passionate experts that work together within an exceptionally open-minded environment
Assisting you in to develop, personally and professionally, to grow internally within an international environment which leverages your abilities, skills and expertise
Providing you the unique opportunity to be part of an ambitious, energetic and rapidly growing Solplanet team with flat hierarchies, fast decision making and strong opportunities to successfully cultivate your long-term path within the renewable energy industry


By submitting your application, you declare your agreement to saving your application data at Aiswei B.V, and that such data may be used for internal purposes in the context of the upcoming application process. If there is no employment, the data will be deleted after six months. The application data are treated confidentially in accordance with the provisions of the Federal Data Protection Act and are not passed on to third parties. You can revoke your consent at any time, either by email or in writing by mail.

Title: Fullstack AI Engineer – WasteHero
Description:
Help us reinvent municipal infrastructure – with AI.

At WasteHero, we're on a mission to build the most advanced, intelligent municipal software platform in Europe. Our customers are cities and waste companies – the backbone of public life – and we help them digitize operations, optimize resources, and become smarter every day. Now, we're ready to go AI-first. And we need a builder.

We're looking for a Fullstack AI Engineer who can combine classic engineering skills with modern AI tooling to ship real, production-grade AI agents, flows, and tools – fast. This isn't a research role. This is about building things that work.

What You’ll Do


Build internal AI agents that automate everything from public tender qualification to API-based integration flows.
Use OpenAI (GPT-4o), LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to develop real, end-to-end flows.
Translate domain knowledge (from product, integration, support) into prompt-based tools, scripts, and interfaces.
Develop backend logic and connect with our main platform via REST APIs, webhooks, and Supabase.
Collaborate directly with our founder, product team, and engineers to prioritize high-impact use cases.
Document and test your agents so they can scale across customers, countries, and products.
Optionally: build or connect frontend UIs via Lovable, Retool, or React.


Who You Are


You have 2–4 years of experience as a fullstack or backend developer.
You've already built real things with AI – agents, automations, internal tools, or API wrappers. (We’re not looking for beginners.)
You're comfortable with JavaScript/TypeScript or Python, REST APIs, and database logic.
You’ve used tools like LangChain, GPT, Claude, Supabase, or n8n — and ideally connected them together.
You love shipping fast, learning fast, and solving real customer problems.
You think in systems. You see the flow between tools, prompts, users, and data.
Bonus: experience with public infrastructure, tenders, waste, logistics, or ERP systems.


Why Join Us


Work on real-world AI problems — not gimmicks.
Be part of a small, ambitious, and product-driven team with deep market traction.
Ship and own projects that get used by municipalities and companies across Europe.
Help define how AI is applied in one of the most operationally complex and underserved domains: waste & city infrastructure.
Enjoy full autonomy, fast feedback loops, and the ability to shape the product and stack.
Located in Aarhus? Great. Prefer hybrid or remote (within CET ±2)? Also great.


Tech Stack You’ll Touch


GPT-4o / OpenAI Functions / Claude
LangChain / n8n / Supabase
Python / Node.js / TypeScript
REST APIs (internal and customer)
Lovable / Retool / React (optional)
Other tech stacks that can improve efficiency


Compensation


Competitive salary based on experience
Equity/warrants
Office in Aarhus C with hybrid flexibility
Real ownership. No bureaucracy.


Ready to build the future of public infrastructure with AI?

Apply here

Let’s make cities smarter — together.
Show more

At WasteHero, we're on a mission to build the most advanced, intelligent municipal software platform in Europe. Our customers are cities and waste companies – the backbone of public life – and we help them digitize operations, optimize resources, and become smarter every day. Now, we're ready to go AI-first. And we need a builder.

We're looking for a Fullstack AI Engineer who can combine classic engineering skills with modern AI tooling to ship real, production-grade AI agents, flows, and tools – fast. This isn't a research role. This is about building things that work.

What You’ll Do

  • Build internal AI agents that automate everything from public tender qualification to API-based integration flows.
  • Use OpenAI (GPT-4o), LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to develop real, end-to-end flows.
  • Translate domain knowledge (from product, integration, support) into prompt-based tools, scripts, and interfaces.
  • Develop backend logic and connect with our main platform via REST APIs, webhooks, and Supabase.
  • Collaborate directly with our founder, product team, and engineers to prioritize high-impact use cases.
  • Document and test your agents so they can scale across customers, countries, and products.
  • Optionally: build or connect frontend UIs via Lovable, Retool, or React.

Who You Are

  • You have 2–4 years of experience as a fullstack or backend developer.
  • You've already built real things with AI – agents, automations, internal tools, or API wrappers. (We’re not looking for beginners.)
  • You're comfortable with JavaScript/TypeScript or Python, REST APIs, and database logic.
  • You’ve used tools like LangChain, GPT, Claude, Supabase, or n8n — and ideally connected them together.
  • You love shipping fast, learning fast, and solving real customer problems.
  • You think in systems. You see the flow between tools, prompts, users, and data.
  • Bonus: experience with public infrastructure, tenders, waste, logistics, or ERP systems.

Why Join Us

  • Work on real-world AI problems — not gimmicks.
  • Be part of a small, ambitious, and product-driven team with deep market traction.
  • Ship and own projects that get used by municipalities and companies across Europe.
  • Help define how AI is applied in one of the most operationally complex and underserved domains: waste & city infrastructure.
  • Enjoy full autonomy, fast feedback loops, and the ability to shape the product and stack.
  • Located in Aarhus? Great. Prefer hybrid or remote (within CET ±2)? Also great.

Tech Stack You’ll Touch

  • GPT-4o / OpenAI Functions / Claude
  • LangChain / n8n / Supabase
  • Python / Node.js / TypeScript
  • REST APIs (internal and customer)
  • Lovable / Retool / React (optional)
  • Other tech stacks that can improve efficiency

Compensation

  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Equity/warrants
  • Office in Aarhus C with hybrid flexibility
  • Real ownership. No bureaucracy.

Ready to build the future of public infrastructure with AI?

Apply here

Let’s make cities smarter — together.

Title: Vice President- Head of LEGO Fortnite ecosystem
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role must be based in Denmark full time

Are you passionate about contributing to the future of family friendly digital play?

Your ability to think on your feet whilst paving the way for a long term ambition will be critical to lead this strategic project for the LEGO Group. Acting like a GM and owning the P&L, you will own our strategic partnership with EPIC Games, ensuring constant mutual value creation and reaching both short and long term goals.

The LEGO Fortnite partnership is multifaceted, from stand alone licensed games, to self developed and published games, to user generated games, and you will lead and establish a meaningful presence inside the ever growing and changing Fortnite environment.


Core Responsibilities





Strategic Partnership management with EPIC Games
P&L ownership
Portfolio development across 1st, 2nd and 3rd party games
Publishing, marketing and UA experience
Driving short and long-term integration with the LEGO owned ecosystem
Continuous development of in-house capabilities




Play your part in our team succeeding

The LEGO Group has decided to dramatically expand its footprint in the gaming world. The EPIC Games partnership sits at the core of this strategy, establishing a long-term presence in open platforms.

You will drive the choices to accelerate the growth of our Fortnite audience, making the most out of what Fortnite has to offer, developing valuable business cases for EPIC Games to invest in and building in-house capabilities to create meaningful LEGO gaming experiences within Fortnite.

Making difficult decisions and negotiating with our partners, you be strong in navigating uncertainty, whilst remaining driven by a unique goal- delighting as many players as possible with LEGO Experiences!

Do you have what it takes?





Deep experience in digital platform management and/or gaming industry
Successful experiences in maintaining and developing strategic partnerships
P&L and digital product development experience
Understanding of legal and financial considerations, incl internal collaborator management
Deep gaming industry knowledge
Understanding / interest for kid-focused experiences
Program management
Marketing and branding strategy
Creator community management




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Title: Lead AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Company Overview

team.blue is the market leader in enabling digital success for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) across Europe, catering to over 3 million customers in 25+ languages. Our mission is to make online business success simpler, by providing our customers with all the tools and resources they need to excel online and remain ahead of the curve.

Position Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Lead AI/ML Engineer to technically lead our AI/ML engineering team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing AI & ML models and GenAI solutions that power real production use cases. This role will collaborate closely with Product, and Commercial teams, and take full ownership from ideation to deployment. The environment is fast-paced and high-responsibility, with plenty of room to grow alongside a technical, mission-driven team.

Key Responsibilities:

AI & ML Model Development & Implementation


Design, develop and optimize AI models and LLMs, including training and fine-tuning for various applications
Build, train and optimize ML models, including defining preprocessing, feature engineering, validation strategies, and hyperparameter tuning
Develop AI solutions using LLMs, agentic AI frameworks, RAG pipelines, MCP servers and other related technologies



AI & ML Engineering


Build data ingestion and transformation pipelines to support model training and deployment and ensure reproducible, scalable models
Verify data quality, perform data cleaning, and oversee data acquisition processes as needed.
Develop scalable training and inference pipelines for AI-powered applications



Deployment & Integration


Deploy models to production and create APIs to integrate AI models into business operations
Build and drive adoption of emerging LLM/MLOPs technologies, integrating AI Agents, RAGs, and LLMs using MCP workflows to streamline automation, performance tuning, and large-scale data insights



Research & Innovation


Continously research and integrate the latest advancements in AI, ML and LLMs into products
Translate scientific insights into working prototypes that bridge research and production-ready implementation
Collaborate with internal and external research partners, including academic institutions, industry labs, and vendors



Technical Leadership


Provide technical leadership in AI/ML technologies, including GenAI, Machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing (NLP).
Ensure the technical quality of AI/ML solutions, including architecture, design, implementation, and deployment.
Mentor junior team members and drive the technical direction of AI initiatives within the group



Requirements:


6+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering, Applied AI or Research engineering, with 2+ years in a lead role
Deep expertise with GenAI technologies and concepts like LLMs, RAG, Vector databases, AI agents, MCP, LoRA, QLoRA
Strong Python skills and experience with ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, sklearn), with a proven track record of building and deploying ML models
Practical experience deploying and scaling AI & ML models and agentic AI applications in a production environment, including with LLM inference and serving (vLLm, LiteLLM, TensorRT-LLM)
Knowledge of LLM/MLOps, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Awareness of LLM-specific risk domains, including hallucinations, fairness, and data privacy
Strong problem-solving skills with excellent communication and documentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams



Nice to have Skills:


Experience building multi-hop RAG systems with self-consistency and chain-of-thought prompting



"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

ESG

“At team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.”

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 3,000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: AI Software Engineer
Description:
We're looking for an AI Software Engineer to help shape the direction of our new AI initiative and build intelligent systems powered by LLMs and AI agents right at the heart of our tech platform.




About CEGO

CEGO is an ambitious software company located by the waterfront in Aalborg. We offer an informal work culture with flexibility, freedom, and a high degree of trust. We operate Spilnu.dk, one of Denmark's largest online casinos, and have expanded our success to the UK with Happy Tiger. We develop everything in-house using open-source technologies from games and platforms to our upcoming AI projects.




About the role

We’re hiring for a newly established position as AI Software Engineer to join us on-site at our office in Aalborg, where you’ll be responsible for developing next-generation AI solutions based on Large Language Models (LLMs), AI agents, and modern AI architectures.




This is a pioneering role where you'll be our first in-house specialist in this field. You'll bring a new technological toolbox to CEGO and play a key role in defining how we work with AI going forward. You'll collaborate closely with our talented developers in the Platform department, who will provide strong technical sparring - but you should thrive in leading the way into new territory.

You’ll be part of our Platform department consisting of 38 colleagues, including DevOps, software developers, UX designers, and frontend developers.




Your main tasks include:

Develop and implement AI solutions using LLMs, AI agents, and machine learning techniques such as fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG (Retriever-Augmented Generation), ReACT, and meta-prompting
Design and optimize agent-based systems using technologies like LangChain, LangGraph, LangSmith, or similar
Build APIs and integrations to connect AI solutions with our existing systems
Contribute to innovation and prototyping across teams and business areas
Stay up to date on AI trends and evaluate how they can be applied to create business value




About you

We imagine you're a proactive team player with a developer mindset and a commercial edge. We’re looking for someone who:




Has a solid understanding of machine learning and can distinguish between classical ML and modern LLM applications
Is familiar with techniques like prompt chaining and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Understands agent-based AI systems and workflow orchestration
Has experience with API development and system integration
Is comfortable evaluating and optimizing AI model performance
Is curious and eager to explore new technologies




We offer:

A chance to join one of Aalborg’s most ambitious and attractive workplaces
Full ownership of our own products and roadmaps - no clients or external deadlines
No time tracking
An agile, flat organization with fast decision-making
Flexible working hours, 30 minutes of paid daily break, and a no-overtime policy
Perks like daily breakfast, in-house gym, personal training twice a week, and massage
A strong focus on well-being, professionalism, and collaboration
Health insurance and pension plan




We know that engaged and skilled employees create the best results. That’s why we work actively to ensure an environment where you can thrive and be challenged at the same time.




How to apply

Submit your CV and a motivated application via our website as soon as possible. We review applications on an ongoing basis. Start date is as soon as possible.




We encourage all qualified candidates to apply - regardless of gender, age, religion, or ethnic background.




About CEGO A/S

Founded in 2000, CEGO A/S operates a number of subsidiaries running online casinos in both Denmark and internationally. In 2012, we launched Spilnu.dk and were among the first companies to receive a casino license when Denmark liberalized its gambling laws.




Spilnu.dk features unique, in-house developed slot machines inspired by the classic "one-armed bandit" with a twist of engaging bonus games for extra fun. The platform encourages a social, cozy gaming experience, allowing players to chat while playing.




Outside Denmark, we operate in the UK under the brand Happy Tiger. CEGO A/S is owned by three Aalborg-based entrepreneurs and the private equity firm VIA equity.




You’ll find us in our inspiring office at the waterfront in Aalborg, where about 130 employees work across game development, web development, game and sound design, graphics, customer support, server administration, and platform operations. We also have departments supporting Compliance & Legal, Marketing, Finance, and HR.

Show more

  • Full ownership of our own products and roadmaps - no clients or external deadlines
  • No time tracking
  • An agile, flat organization with fast decision-making
  • Flexible working hours, 30 minutes of paid daily break, and a no-overtime policy
  • Perks like daily breakfast, in-house gym, personal training twice a week, and massage
  • A strong focus on well-being, professionalism, and collaboration
  • Health insurance and pension plan


We know that engaged and skilled employees create the best results. That’s why we work actively to ensure an environment where you can thrive and be challenged at the same time.


How to apply

Submit your CV and a motivated application via our website as soon as possible. We review applications on an ongoing basis. Start date is as soon as possible.


We encourage all qualified candidates to apply - regardless of gender, age, religion, or ethnic background.


About CEGO A/S

Founded in 2000, CEGO A/S operates a number of subsidiaries running online casinos in both Denmark and internationally. In 2012, we launched Spilnu.dk and were among the first companies to receive a casino license when Denmark liberalized its gambling laws.


Spilnu.dk features unique, in-house developed slot machines inspired by the classic "one-armed bandit" with a twist of engaging bonus games for extra fun. The platform encourages a social, cozy gaming experience, allowing players to chat while playing.


Outside Denmark, we operate in the UK under the brand Happy Tiger. CEGO A/S is owned by three Aalborg-based entrepreneurs and the private equity firm VIA equity.


You’ll find us in our inspiring office at the waterfront in Aalborg, where about 130 employees work across game development, web development, game and sound design, graphics, customer support, server administration, and platform operations. We also have departments supporting Compliance & Legal, Marketing, Finance, and HR.

Title: Freelance Mathematics Expert - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

Generative AI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Content Creation & Refinement: Create and refine content to ensure accuracy and relevance across a variety of topics in Mathematics, while also developing references and examples of tasks.
Experts Acquisition: Assess the qualification tests of experts, ensuring their competency.
Chat Moderation: Provide support by addressing project-related questions from other experts in Discord chats, especially those related to project guidelines.
Auditing Work: Review and evaluate tasks completed by other experts, ensuring they align with project guidelines. Provide constructive feedback, verify expertise-related information, and edit content as necessary to improve quality


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Mathematics
You have at least 5 years of professional experience.
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
Experience in Generative AI/Prompt engineering/Reviewing
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: R&D Mechanical Engineer
Description:
Vil du være med til at udvikle fremtidens tekniske hjælpemidler, som kan give mennesker en bedre livskvalitet? Og har du samtidig lyst til at arbejde i en ambitiøs international virksomhed med kollegaer i mange lande. Så er du måske den R&D Mechanical Engineer, vi søger til Patient Handling ved Horsens?

Om jobbet

Du vil skulle arbejde med produktudvikling omfattende flere forskellige teknologier, materialetyper og produktområder. Produkterne er omfattet af det medicinske regulativ (MDR) og en – på sigt - god forståelse af dette, markedet og kunderne er væsentlige forudsætninger for succes i rollen.

Opgaverne vil primært omfatte længerevarende udviklingsforløb kombineret med mindre kortsigtede projekter/opgaver, der til tider besluttes iværksat med baggrund i et specifikt kunde behov.

Du bliver en del af vores Patient Handling team i Gedved, der beskæftiger sig med kundesupport og udvikling af Molift og Immedia produkterne.

Dine konkrete arbejdsopgaver vil især omfatte:


Udvikling af nye produkter og div. tilbehør med tilhørende dokumentation og manualer.
Arbejde med konstruktioner i aluminium og stål samt støbte emner i både plast og metal, herunder føre dialogen direkte med underleverandører om fremstillings teknik.
Gennemføre tests af de udviklede produkter i laboratorium og/eller i marken.
Sparring med kollegaer i andre funktionsområder herunder produktion samt elektronik og software teamet.
Arbejde med/efter/mod standarder godkendelser og frembringe dokumentation hertil.
Medvirke til afdelingens faglige udvikling og sociale sammenhold
Deltage aktivt i risikovurderinger (DFMEA/PFMEA)
Diverse ad-hoc-opgaver.


Stillingen refererer direkte til R&D-chefen.

Du skal regne med en vis planlagt rejseaktivitet primært i Europa på 20 til 30 dage årligt – oftest 1-3 dages ture.

Kvalifikationer

Du har sikkert en grundlæggende uddannelse som M-ingeniør, gerne med sundhedsfaglig erfaring/baggrund, men det er ikke et krav.

Det er en krævende stilling og vi søger derfor en person med flere års praktisk erfaring fra udvikling af mekaniske produkter i en produktions- eller konsulentvirksomhed.

Det er en fordel hvis ud har erfaring med det medicinske regulativ (MDR).

Du behersker MS-Officepakken på avanceret brugerniveau med fokus på Excel.

Du har kendskab til gængse ERP-systemer og du er helt fortrolig med avanceret brug af 3D-CAD og PDM – Etac anvender SolidWorks.

Du behersker dansk på modersmålsniveau og engelsk på forhandlingsniveau i skrift og tale.

På det personlige plan bør du kunne genkende dig selv i nedenstående:


Rummer både kreative og analytiske elementer, der gør at du skaber innovative og brugbare løsninger.
Struktureret og detaljeorienteret uden at det går ud over overblikskapacitet og prioriteringerne.
Leverer løsninger til tiden i et velfungerende samarbejde med andre funktioner.
Udviklingsorienteret, pragmatisk og proaktiv.
Du er rejsevant i Europa og har en god interkulturel kompetence.
Positivt sind og godt humør gør bestemt ikke noget, og du er klar til at give en hånd og sparre med og støtte kollegaerne i deres opgaver.


Virksomheden tilbyder

Du får et afvekslende og inspirerende job i en moderne, international og hastigt voksende virksomhed med betydelige jobmæssige udfordringer og tværorganisatorisk arbejde – ofte på tværs af landegrænser.

Du vil opleve at man har de bedst tænkelige arbejdsredskaber og du møder en flok dedikerede og dygtige kolleger i et uformelt og dynamisk miljø.

Du får således en god mulighed for en solid personlig og faglig udvikling i et spændende internationalt markedssegment.

Der er højt til loftet og betydelige frihedsgrader i jobbet baseret på gensidig tillid.

Om os

Patient Handling med Molift og Immedia er to blandt flere produktbrands i Etac Group.

Etac Group er en verdensførende udvikler af innovative hjælpemidler og patienthåndteringsudstyr. Siden 1973 har vi været forpligtet til at forbedre livskvaliteten for den enkelte, familiemedlemmer og pårørende. Gennem vores specialiserede produktmærker tilbyder vi state-of-the-art løsninger til en bred vifte af daglige behov og plejemiljøer for mennesker på alle stadier af livet.

Etac har hovedsæde i Sverige og mere end 1500 ansatte på verdensplan og salg i over 70 lande gennem salgsselskaber og distributører. Etac Group er repræsenteret globalt med datterselskaber i både Danmark, Sverige, Norge, England, Frankrig, USA, Tyskland, Italien, Holland og Australien. Herudover leverer eksportafdelingen til store dele af verden. I Gedved er vi ca. 200 medarbejdere, heraf ca. 25 medarbejdere i Patient Handling.

Du kan læse mere om Etac Group: https://www.etac.com/ hvor du også finder mere viden om Molift og Immedia.

Interesseret?

Stillingen ønskes besat snarest muligt og vi holder løbende samtaler. Har du spørgsmål, kan du kontakte Peter Jensen, Head of R&D PBU Patient Handling, på tlf.: 20 13 28 51
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Rust) - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Rust
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: R&D Application Engineer
Place: Ringkøbing-Skjern Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Join Our Global R&D Team as an Application Engineer

Are you passionate about bridging cutting-edge R&D with real-world production? Do you enjoy hands-on experimentation, rapid prototyping, and turning ideas into tangible improvements? Then this could be your next exciting opportunity!




At the Va group (Vestas aircoil), we’re engineering the future of heat transfer solutions. As part of our global R&D team, you’ll help turn lab concepts into automated processes - bringing innovation directly to our production sites across the world.




What You’ll Be Doing

As R&D Application Engineer, you’ll help scale new technology from lab to production (TRL4 to TRL7), working closely with production teams and our Romanian site. You will:

Accelerate technology implementation in production
Mature New Technologies through rapid experimentation, prototyping and technical development
Lead development projects and drive automation projects
Collaborate cross-functionally to scope and deliver value-focused solutions
Translate technical concepts for non-specialist audiences
Support patent applications and promote our R&D lab internally and externally
Run small-scale experiments and rapid prototyping (machining/additive manufacturing)
Ensure lab compliance and contribute to maintaining a safe, innovative workspace




What We’re Looking For

Technical degree (Mechanical/Marine Engineer, Toolmaker, or similar)
Understand mechanical and mechatronic systems and how tools and machinery operate
Understanding the properties of different materials and their suitability for specific tools or applications in productions
Structured, curious mindset with strong communication skills
Willingness to travel as part of the role is required
Fluent in English (written/spoken)
Comfortable with MS Office, Teams, and SharePoint




Why Join Us?

We are a growing global company with Danish roots and a reputation for excellence in industrial cooling solutions. While our size allows for agility and personal impact, our global presence offers collaboration across borders and disciplines.




We pride ourselves on our informal yet professional work culture, where innovation, integrity, and continuous improvement guide our daily actions. You’ll join a supportive team that values your initiative, curiosity, and desire to make a difference.




Ready to Apply?

If this sounds like your next step, we’d love to hear from you. We review applications on a rolling basis. Questions? Reach out to HR Generalist, Maria Skallerup at +45 3118 9319 or ms@vestas-aircoil.com or Group R&D Director, Claus Hessler Ibsen at ci@vetas-aircoil.com.




Let’s shape the future of heat transfer innovation - together.

Show more

Title: Robotics Technician
Description:
ROBOT TECHNICIAN COPENHAGEN BASED WITH EXTENSIVE TRAVELLING WORLDWIDE




CLIIN Robotics is looking for a Robot Technician to train and demonstrate our solutions to customers in the maritime and oil & gas industries worldwide.




About CLIIN Robotics:

We are a young, ambitious, innovative company working for a cleaner and safer future in the maritime and oil & gas industries. We design, develop and build proprietary robotic solutions for vessel cargo hold and hull cleaning, replacing ineffective, dangerous, and polluting traditional cleaning operations. In addition, our robotic platform and sustainable value propositions are being deployed across other industries, e.g. tank storage, offshore installations, which provide a unique opportunity to further expand the business across various business segments worldwide.




About the job:

Our solutions constitute a paradigm shift to traditional maritime cleaning methods and are gaining significant market traction. Our Robot Technicians’ engagement is key to ensuring that our customers are yielding maximum value from the deployment of our solutions. 




After a period of thorough introduction to our technology and solutions at our head office in Copenhagen, Denmark, you will travel to our customers in a range of different deployment settings worldwide in order to train and demonstrate operability and maintenance. Thus ability and flexibility to travel are a prerequisite.




It is essential that you are a solid communicator and can engage in profound customer dialogues and foster long-term relationships.




When not travelling, you will continue to render support to our customers on an as-needed basis, and form part of our production and development team in order to stay abreast with our technology and contribute to the continued development.




You will be part of a growing organization and a growing number of Robot Technicians at CLIIN Robotics.




Location: Copenhagen-based

To foster close collaboration with our team, this role requires you to be based in Denmark. We have a strong preference for candidates living within commuting distance of our Copenhagen office.




Profile:

The preferred candidate has a solid technical education and background, preferably from the shipping or offshore industries.




Responsibilities:

Demonstrate our solutions at our customer settings worldwide.
Train end users in solutions, operations and maintenance.
Render continued technical/operational support to customers through mail and phone.
Build and test solutions for customers.
Participate in internal tests and continued solutions development.
Observe and collect development opportunities based on experience from practical deployment.




The job is for you if:

You have a technical education (electrician, marine engineer, technical engineer or similar) and subsequent practical experience.
Experience from shipping and/or oil & gas.
Strong ability to work both independently and in teams.
Solid communicator and good at building relationships.
Thrive in a flat organization with a “can do” attitude.
As a minimum, are fluent in English (written and spoken). Proficiency in Spanish will be seen as a significant advantage.
You are willing to travel around 200+ days a year.




Come work with us!

You will be a part of a dynamic international and highly professional team of experts with significant experience. By becoming a CLIIN Robotics employee, you will be part of a growing, innovative organization with room to develop.

Like the rest of us - you want to change the world to a better place for this generation and beyond.




Ready to Apply? Don't wait 

For further information, please contact Sales Director, Thomas Joergensen (+45 29249712) or email your application and CV to e-mail: tj@cliin.dk 




Applications are evaluated continuously, and interviews will take place as soon as possible. Until we have found the right person. 




Your application will be treated with confidentiality.




We look forward to hearing from you and reviewing your application and CV. 

Show more
HTML:
ROBOT TECHNICIAN COPENHAGEN BASED WITH EXTENSIVE TRAVELLING WORLDWIDE


CLIIN Robotics is looking for a Robot Technician to train and demonstrate our solutions to customers in the maritime and oil & gas industries worldwide.


About CLIIN Robotics:

We are a young, ambitious, innovative company working for a cleaner and safer future in the maritime and oil & gas industries. We design, develop and build proprietary robotic solutions for vessel cargo hold and hull cleaning, replacing ineffective, dangerous, and polluting traditional cleaning operations. In addition, our robotic platform and sustainable value propositions are being deployed across other industries, e.g. tank storage, offshore installations, which provide a unique opportunity to further expand the business across various business segments worldwide.


About the job:

Our solutions constitute a paradigm shift to traditional maritime cleaning methods and are gaining significant market traction. Our Robot Technicians’ engagement is key to ensuring that our customers are yielding maximum value from the deployment of our solutions. 


After a period of thorough introduction to our technology and solutions at our head office in Copenhagen, Denmark, you will travel to our customers in a range of different deployment settings worldwide in order to train and demonstrate operability and maintenance. Thus ability and flexibility to travel are a prerequisite.


It is essential that you are a solid communicator and can engage in profound customer dialogues and foster long-term relationships.


When not travelling, you will continue to render support to our customers on an as-needed basis, and form part of our production and development team in order to stay abreast with our technology and contribute to the continued development.


You will be part of a growing organization and a growing number of Robot Technicians at CLIIN Robotics.


Location: Copenhagen-based

To foster close collaboration with our team, this role requires you to be based in Denmark. We have a strong preference for candidates living within commuting distance of our Copenhagen office.


Profile:

The preferred candidate has a solid technical education and background, preferably from the shipping or offshore industries.


Responsibilities:

  • Demonstrate our solutions at our customer settings worldwide.
  • Train end users in solutions, operations and maintenance.
  • Render continued technical/operational support to customers through mail and phone.
  • Build and test solutions for customers.
  • Participate in internal tests and continued solutions development.
  • Observe and collect development opportunities based on experience from practical deployment.


The job is for you if:

  • You have a technical education (electrician, marine engineer, technical engineer or similar) and subsequent practical experience.
  • Experience from shipping and/or oil & gas.
  • Strong ability to work both independently and in teams.
  • Solid communicator and good at building relationships.
  • Thrive in a flat organization with a “can do” attitude.
  • As a minimum, are fluent in English (written and spoken). Proficiency in Spanish will be seen as a significant advantage.
  • You are willing to travel around 200+ days a year.


Come work with us!

You will be a part of a dynamic international and highly professional team of experts with significant experience. By becoming a CLIIN Robotics employee, you will be part of a growing, innovative organization with room to develop.

Like the rest of us - you want to change the world to a better place for this generation and beyond.


Ready to Apply? Don't wait 

For further information, please contact Sales Director, Thomas Joergensen (+45 29249712) or email your application and CV to e-mail: tj@cliin.dk 


Applications are evaluated continuously, and interviews will take place as soon as possible. Until we have found the right person. 


Your application will be treated with confidentiality.


We look forward to hearing from you and reviewing your application and CV.

Title: Bliv luksusbrandevaluator i Copenhagen, DK - Ansøg nu
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Forvandl din passion for luksus til en karrieremulighed. Udforsk verdenen af premium-mærker, og skab en varig indflydelse inden for mode, skønhed, smykker eller biler. Bliv en del af CXG, den globale leder inden for kundeoplevelser, og arbejd sammen med ikoniske navne som Louis Vuitton, Dolce & Gabbana, Bentley, Prada, Versace og mange flere.

Om rollen:

Som luksusbrandevaluator træder du ind i luksusverdenen for diskret at vurdere kundeoplevelser og levere værdifuld feedback, der hjælper mærker med at forbedre deres tjenester. Uanset om du besøger butikker, køber online eller returnerer et produkt, vil din stemme forme fremtiden for luksus.


Fleksibilitet - Hvert butiksbesøg varer cirka 20 minutter, hvilket giver dig fleksibilitet til at udføre flere opgaver
Hyppige muligheder - Udfør flere missioner om måneden og samarbejd med nogle af verdens mest prestigefyldte mærker


Vores luksuspartnere:

Mode & couture


Louis Vuitton, Saint Laurent, Balenciaga, Versace, Prada, Moncler, Fendi, Bottega Veneta, Ferragamo, COS, Bally, Dolce & Gabbana


Smykker & ure


Tiffany & Co., De Beers, Piaget, IWC, Boucheron, Pandora


Skønhed & hudpleje


Guerlain, Sephora, L'Oréal, Givenchy


Biler


Bentley, Jaguar, Genesis, Maserati, Vespa


Hvad du skal gøre:


Vælg dine opgaver - Tilpas dine missioner til dine personlige præferencer og din profil
Besøg luksusbutikker eller vurder online - Interagér med salgsassistenter i butikkerne eller hjemmefra online
Observer nøje - Undersøg stemningen, servicekvaliteten og den overordnede kundeoplevelse
Giv ærlig feedback - Brug vores platform til at dele dine observationer via spørgeskemaer


Fordele ved rollen:


Samarbejd med ikoniske mærker på tværs af brancher
Fleksible opgaver skræddersyet til dine interesser
Kompensation for din tid og indsats med mulighed for refusion af køb
En brugervenlig platform til at administrere missioner og feedback


Sådan bliver du en del af CXG-fællesskabet:


Registrer dig: Tilmeld dig på live.cxg.com og bekræft din e-mail
Udfyld din profil: Indtast dine oplysninger 100%, og få din profil verificeret
Bliv certificeret: Bestå General Certification for at få adgang til missioner
Ansøg om missioner: Udforsk opgaver med mærker, der interesserer dig
Start evaluering: Begynd at gøre en forskel på luksusmarkedet


Kompensation:


Ikke-købsevalueringer: Tjen et honorar baseret på missionens kompleksitet
Købsevalueringer: Refusion for godkendte varer som angivet i missionens beskrivelse


Om CXG

Hos CXG forbinder vi premium-mærker med over 80.000 evaluatorer i 70 lande. Med 12 globale kontorer og næsten to årtiers ekspertise inden for detailhandel med kundeoplevelser er vi dedikerede til at omdefinere kundeoplevelsen for luksusgiganter.

Bliv en del af os, og nyd fleksibiliteten ved at arbejde på farten med vores mobilplatform, CXG Live. På denne platform kan du nemt administrere missioner, certificeringer og feedback.

Requirements


Skal være 18 år eller ældre
Nuværende kunde hos premium- og luksusmærker
Må ikke være under kontrakt med nogen detailmærker for at sikre upartiskhed
Præcis, organiseret, detaljeorienteret og pålidelig
Observerende og passioneret omkring kundeoplevelser
Ingen tidligere erfaring er nødvendig; vi værdsætter ærlig feedback fra ægte kunder
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (JavaScript) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Code generation and code review
Prompt evaluation and complex data annotation
Training and evaluation of large language models
Benchmarking and agent-based code execution in sandboxed environments
Working across multiple programming languages (Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Rust, SQL, etc.)
Adapting guidelines for new domains and use cases
Following project-specific rubrics and requirements
Collaborating with project leads, solution engineers, and supply managers on complex or experimental projects


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Ruby, hands-on experience with JS testing frameworks (Jest, Mocha, Cypress) and browser automation
Experience using, integrating, or tutoring others on AI tools in the QA or development process
Experience documenting and tracking defects clearly
Hackathon or competitive coding experience is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Ekspert i elektronisk overvågning, FE, KøbenhavnØ
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du lyst til, i samarbejde med andre, at beskytte Forsvarets hemmeligheder, og være med til at udvikle hvordan Forsvaret anvender elektronisk overvågning og TV-overvågning, både inden for kongerigets grænser (Danmark, Færøerne og Grønland) og i de brændpunkter, hvor der er danske soldater indsat? Så kan du blive vores nye kollega. Vi søger lige nu en tekniker inden for elektronisk overvågning (AIA), TV-overvågning (TVO) og adgangskontrolanlæg (ADK).

Du får udfordringer og plads til at udvikle dig

Vi søger en medarbejder, der både kan indgå i sammensatte hold og arbejde selvstændigt i Danmark og i udlandet, hvor der er dansk militær repræsentation.

Du skal kunne arbejde tæt sammen med andre eksperter inden for militær sikkerhed og det er en fordel at du kendskab til eller har arbejdet med Forsvarets bestemmelser for fysisk sikkerhed, FKOBST 358-1, ”Bestemmelser for den militære sikkerhedstjeneste”.

Stillingen er meget udadvendt og du skal repræsentere Forebyggende Sikkerhed i forskellige, faglige fora. Du får en hverdag, som du i høj grad selv skal tilrettelægge, med stort ansvar og samtidig stor personlig frihed. Du får en hverdag, hvor du har en meget bred kontakt med alle dele af Forsvaret. Stillingen kan i perioder kræve en del rejseaktivitet, hvilket sker i samarbejde med sikkerhedsrådgiverne i Forebyggende Sikkerhed.

Det er vigtigt, at du kan formidle din tekniske viden gennem opsøgende rådgivningsarbejde (både i skrift og tale), at du kan undervise og at du på fleksibel vis kan gå i dialog med vores kunder, så I sammen finder løsninger, der tilgodeser de formelle krav og de muliges kunst.

Dine Vigtigste Opgaver


Gennemføre sikkerhedsrådgivning inden for elektronisk overvågning, TV-overvågning og adgangskontrolanlæg.
Gennemføre selvstændig sagsbehandling i forbindelse med kontrol af allerede eksisterende anlæg.
I samarbejde med sikkerhedsrådgiverne rådgive om elektroniske sikringsløsninger, som kan anvendes operativt af forsvarets enheder.
Deltage i planlægningen, tilrettelæggelsen og gennemførelsen af FE’s eftersyns- og inspektionsvirke.
Gennemføre kontrol og efterfølgende godkendelse af ny etableret elektroniske anlæg.
Gennemføre studievirksomhed af udviklingen og tendenser inden for området.


Du og din baggrund er vigtig


Erfaring som sikringsteknikker,
Erfaring som supporter for sikringsteknikker inden for de almen anvendte elektroniske overvågningssystemer.
Det er en fordel, men ikke et ultimativt krav at du praktisk erfaring og rådgivningserfaring med sikringsløsninger anvendt i Forsvaret, herunder kendskab til, hvordan de adskiller sig fra øvrige regelsæt.


Det er hensigtsmæssigt, at følgende uddannelse er gennemført – men ikke et ultimativt krav


DBI – Eksamineret sikringsleder


Din nye arbejdsplads

Forsvarets Efterretningstjeneste (FE) er Danmarks udenrigsefterretningstjeneste og arbejder – hemmeligt og åbent – for at beskytte Danmark og danske interesser i en foranderlig verden.

Vi er ikke alene om at beskytte Danmark, men vi er den eneste myndighed, der har fået mandat til at udnytte helt særlige midler til at afdække, hvad andre stater og udenlandske aktører forsøger at holde hemmeligt. Det giver mening for os at bidrage til fred, tryghed og sikkerhed for danskerne, både i den analoge og i den digitale verden og det gør vi ved at afdække, vurdere, rådgive om og modvirke både aktuelle trusler og trusler under udvikling.

Vi værdsætter styrken i vores mangfoldighed med dybe fagligheder og specialister og vi er en helt speciel og operativt orienteret vidensorganisation, der har mange forskellige opgaver, men fælles for dem alle er det vidensgrundlag, som vores efterretningsarbejde skaber.

Ansættelsesvilkår

Du ansættes i henhold til den enhver tid gældende overenskomst. Derudover har du mulighed for at forhandle løntillæg efter kvalifikationer.

Den gennemsnitlige arbejdstid er 37 timer om ugen inklusiv betalt frokostpause. Til stillingen hører en pensionsordning, som Forsvarets Efterretningstjeneste betaler.

Som ansat i FE er du omfattet af nogle særlige vilkår. Det er et krav, at du kan sikkerhedsgodkendes og opretholde sikkerhedsgodkendelsen under hele din ansættelse.

Dit faste tjenestested vil være København Ø.

Som i Forsvaret har du pligt til kortvarig udsendelse til udlandet.

Sådan søger du stillingen

Du skal sende din ansøgning og CV via stillingsopslaget senest den 17. august 2025.

Vi forventer, at de indledende ansættelsessamtaler vil finde sted i uge 34 og 35 og stiler mod en ansættelse fra 1. oktober 2025 eller snarest derefter.

Du er velkommen til at kontakte den lokale HR-partner på mailadresserne FE-1119@mil.dk (i ugerne 28/29 & 33) eller 22376@ddis.dk (i uge 32), hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen eller ønsker flere oplysninger.

Du kan også læse mere på https://fe-ddis.dk, hvor du blandt andet finder vores ”Beretning” og kan få et mere detaljeret indblik i FE´s opgaver, FE som arbejdsplads og yderligere information om ansættelsesmæssige spørgsmål.

Vi glæder os til at modtage din ansøgning.

Arbejdstid: Dag

HTML:
Har du lyst til, i samarbejde med andre, at beskytte Forsvarets hemmeligheder, og være med til at udvikle hvordan Forsvaret anvender elektronisk overvågning og TV-overvågning, både inden for kongerigets grænser (Danmark, Færøerne og Grønland) og i de brændpunkter, hvor der er danske soldater indsat? Så kan du blive vores nye kollega. Vi søger lige nu en tekniker inden for elektronisk overvågning (AIA), TV-overvågning (TVO) og adgangskontrolanlæg (ADK).

Du får udfordringer og plads til at udvikle dig

Vi søger en medarbejder, der både kan indgå i sammensatte hold og arbejde selvstændigt i Danmark og i udlandet, hvor der er dansk militær repræsentation.

Du skal kunne arbejde tæt sammen med andre eksperter inden for militær sikkerhed og det er en fordel at du kendskab til eller har arbejdet med Forsvarets bestemmelser for fysisk sikkerhed, FKOBST 358-1, ”Bestemmelser for den militære sikkerhedstjeneste”.

Stillingen er meget udadvendt og du skal repræsentere Forebyggende Sikkerhed i forskellige, faglige fora. Du får en hverdag, som du i høj grad selv skal tilrettelægge, med stort ansvar og samtidig stor personlig frihed. Du får en hverdag, hvor du har en meget bred kontakt med alle dele af Forsvaret. Stillingen kan i perioder kræve en del rejseaktivitet, hvilket sker i samarbejde med sikkerhedsrådgiverne i Forebyggende Sikkerhed.

Det er vigtigt, at du kan formidle din tekniske viden gennem opsøgende rådgivningsarbejde (både i skrift og tale), at du kan undervise og at du på fleksibel vis kan gå i dialog med vores kunder, så I sammen finder løsninger, der tilgodeser de formelle krav og de muliges kunst.

Dine Vigtigste Opgaver

  • Gennemføre sikkerhedsrådgivning inden for elektronisk overvågning, TV-overvågning og adgangskontrolanlæg.
  • Gennemføre selvstændig sagsbehandling i forbindelse med kontrol af allerede eksisterende anlæg.
  • I samarbejde med sikkerhedsrådgiverne rådgive om elektroniske sikringsløsninger, som kan anvendes operativt af forsvarets enheder.
  • Deltage i planlægningen, tilrettelæggelsen og gennemførelsen af FE’s eftersyns- og inspektionsvirke.
  • Gennemføre kontrol og efterfølgende godkendelse af ny etableret elektroniske anlæg.
  • Gennemføre studievirksomhed af udviklingen og tendenser inden for området.

Du og din baggrund er vigtig

  • Erfaring som sikringsteknikker,
  • Erfaring som supporter for sikringsteknikker inden for de almen anvendte elektroniske overvågningssystemer.
  • Det er en fordel, men ikke et ultimativt krav at du praktisk erfaring og rådgivningserfaring med sikringsløsninger anvendt i Forsvaret, herunder kendskab til, hvordan de adskiller sig fra øvrige regelsæt.

Det er hensigtsmæssigt, at følgende uddannelse er gennemført – men ikke et ultimativt krav

  • DBI – Eksamineret sikringsleder
